story:
Once upon a time, in a small village nestled in the heart of Mexico, there was a kind and curious little boy named Diego. Diego lived with his parents and his beloved abuela, who was known throughout the village for her delicious tamales and enchanting stories.

One day, Diego asked Abuela, "Why do we always seem to have enough food, even when times are tough?"

Abuela smiled and replied, "It is because of the magic of our village, mi querido. Long ago, our ancestors were blessed with a special gift â€“ a magical chicken that lays golden eggs. The chicken lives deep in the forest, and every full moon, it lays an egg that brings food and prosperity to our village."

Diego's eyes widened with excitement and wonder. "A magical chicken? Can we visit it, Abuela?"

Abuela chuckled. "No, nieto, the magical chicken is very elusive and can only be found by those with pure hearts and a true sense of adventure. But do not worry, one day, you will embark on a journey to find the magical chicken, and it will be an extraordinary adventure."

Years passed, and Diego grew into a brave, strong, and kind young man. He spent his days learning the ways of the village and helping his family and neighbors. His heart was pure, and his spirit was adventurous, just as Abuela had said.

One full moon night, the villagers gathered to give thanks for the magical chicken's gift. Diego, feeling a surge of excitement, decided that the time had come to embark on his journey. He approached Abuela and said, "Abuela, I am ready to find the magical chicken and bring its gift to our village."

Abuela nodded, her eyes shimmering with pride. She handed him a small bag of cornmeal and said, "Take this, Diego. It is a gift from me. Scatter the cornmeal on your path, and it will show you the way to the magical chicken."

With Abuela's words of wisdom and a heart full of courage, Diego set off into the forest. He followed the glow of the full moon and scattered the cornmeal as he walked. The trail of cornmeal shimmered in the moonlight, guiding him deeper into the forest.

As Diego ventured on, he encountered wild animals and faced obstacles, but his kind heart and strong spirit allowed him to overcome each challenge. Eventually, the path led him to a clearing where a beautiful, golden chicken shone brightly in the moonlight.

"Magical chicken!" Diego exclaimed. "Your gift of golden eggs has brought food and happiness to my village. I am here to thank you and to bring your gift back to my people."

The magical chicken cocked its head, as though understanding Diego's words. It clucked softly, and then, to Diego's amazement, it laid a golden egg.

Overwhelmed with gratitude, Diego carefully picked up the egg and began his journey back to the village. The cornmeal trail led him straight back to his family and friends, who couldn't believe their eyes when they saw the golden egg.

From that day forward, the villagers celebrated Diego as the brave young man who brought the magical chicken's gift to their village. And every full moon, Diego would venture once more into the forest with Abuela's bag of cornmeal, always finding his way back to the magical chicken and retrieving its golden eggs to share with the village.

With each passing year, the village grew stronger and more prosperous, all thanks to the magical chicken and the kind-hearted young man who embarked on a journey to bring its gift home.

And so, dear son, as you drift off to sleep, remember the story of Diego and the magical chicken. May it inspire you to be brave, kind, and true to your heart, just like Diego. Goodnight, and sweet dreams.
